title: Patch Chat with the Playtest Team - 7.22
body:
https://i.imgur.com/38Xzv7U.jpg
Image by xmoonlitxdreamx

Hey everyone and welcome to the Patch 7.22, the pre-season patch. It’s time for Runes Reforged!

I’m Riot Novalas & I’m a QA Analyst on Riot’s Playtest Team, a group of high elo players who work on Core Gameplay playing new champions, reworks, balance tweaks, items, and map updates before they’re released. It’s our job to test the changes that our designers come up with and ensure that we’re introducing positive changes to League in terms of both balance and fun. 

Patch Chat serves as an opportunity for us to talk about the patches that come out every two weeks. You can find the most recent patch by following this link: https://na.leagueoflegends.com/en/news/game-updates/patch/patch-722-notes

We’re in pre-season now! This patch consists of massive, mega, uber changes to the game! Say goodbye to the old system of Runes and Masteries as we bring on the new Runes Reforged system!  Whether you’re into breaking the attack speed cap or infinitely stacking damage boosts, chucking a meteor or swapping your summoner spells, summoning a pet to assist you or looting your foes, there’s a keystone for you! There’s also a plethora of other runes in each tree that’ll allow you to do cool things such as gaining CDR on your ultimate or acquiring free boots after a period of time! 

Accompanying Runes Reforged, we’re also changing items, jungle catch-up XP, adding in a new leveling system, revamping our IP system, and MORE! 

Ask us anything about the patch, our favorite rune builds on YOUR favorite champions, our favorite pair of socks, how often we execute to jungle camps, and more!... Or feel free to just chat with us! We like people (mostly).

Disclaimer: We don’t have any insight into skins. 

Don “Riot Aesah” Ding
Adam “Riot Afic” Cohen

replies.body: Has King Cobra grown tired of his 15 minutes of fame?
How can you ever get tired of starting the game with a 2k gold lead and leap strike in every direction

No plans to rework the tutorial that I know of (although we have no insight into who, if anyone, is working on that).  We focus more on high level gameplay implications of changes, which is about as far away from the tutorial that you can get.

It's both sad and true {{sticker:cass-cry}}
Curious when do you guys open up playtest positions at Riot?
My best guess is we will open hiring again within the next couple of months (but don't quote me on that!)
We recently hired a lot of Playtesters. Not sure when we'd need more, but the time will come eventually.
Only asking because Valkrin has expressed interest in joining the team to prevent another Galio situation
He'd still have to pass the interview like any other candidate. We've interviewed streamers/many ex-pros before, and will be happy to continue :)

Hi SpiderAxe!

I'm the newest addition to the Playtest. Just joined last month and it's been a blast getting to know all the awesome Rioters on the team. I've been a support main since Season 2, born and raised from Brooklyn NY, and love Arizona Green Tea and square pizza.

I personally treat it like masteries, where in previous patches I only ran 1 mastery page and changed it every game in lobby depending on what I was playing. I think you'll find that after a while of getting used to it, since you're only filling 6 slots you should be able to do it in champ select if you have some idea of what you want. But for now, that's why we have the extra 15 seconds of loadout to give you some more time to figure out whatcha want.

This absolutely sucks.  You may be ok with changing the page every game, but more casual players that don't play enough to memorize the individual selections are screwed.  I had many rune pages and mastery pages with key word titles because of this reason.
Riot people higher in this thread talking about it taking a month for them to get it down for last minute changes and they do it day in and day out.  Those of us that commit to that time are screwed.

How long did it take you to get to the point where you would pick a champion and already have in the back of your head which runes you wanted and were able to make last second switches easily because you knew them all pretty well.  The extra 15 seconds for choosing a loadout is going to help but it still seems stressful as there are so many options and synergies

Personally I find it quite easy to think of which runes I want for the primary splash, but find choosing a secondary to be the confusing part. I'd agree with Madness Heroooooo0o00oo00o that it takes about a month to internalize, but we might have accelerated that process since we pretty much thought about these runes for every day for many months!

It took me about a month or so. Really just comes down to actually having all the different options memorized so you can instantly think of what synergizes with a champion instead of frantically looking through all the trees for something that seems good.
Since splashing in sorcery is perfectly attractive to ADCs, what's the plan if nullifying orb on every marksman becomes standard and neuters AP assassins?

We would likely look to nerf Nullifying Orb if that becomes standard. As is I think AD's have a lot of options for what to splash based on the game. Hopefully it bears out that Nullifying Orb is a good option against AP heavy teams or Support Mages like Zyra/Brand, and not a default option.

Even if it's a reactionary grab, I don't want to feel like if the ADC sees my Evelynn in champ select and chooses nullifying orb because of it, I've been completely countered in pregame rune selection is all.

But thanks for the very prompt response!
I definitely like it! i thought i wasn't going to but these are easy to adapt to and you guys made me happy today i received Arclight Yorick in the mystery skins!

Glad to hear it!  Now is as good a time as ever to play yorick too (make sure to take demolisher in the resolve tree.  With that and your Q which can now hit turrets, you can wreck them suuuper quickly)

What do you feel is the replacement for armor runes vs ad mid laners? 
How strong do you feel is perfect timing to include in the second path of a mage?
What do you think are the best complements as second paths for Sorcery?
Besides that anything you can say about Lissandra is welcome!

Splashing Resolve for Iron Skin vs. an aggressive AD mid is totally cool- the Perfect Timing in Inspiration is a very viable choice IMO and makes Zed players salty.

Lissandra can go Arcane Comet or Electrocute depending whether you want more poke damage in lane (e.g., top vs melee) or more all-in damage (midlane). Predator could give her spicy roams too although I haven’t tried it

^ this

Resolve splash to survive tough lanes is surprisingly impactful.  Have had a lot of success doing that in testing.
Iron Skin/Mirror Shield look really unimpressive on paper, would you say they actually compare favorably to similar offensive masteries in terms of impact?

I've tried Iron Skin a lot and have been thoroughly unimpressed.

I find it's typically better to go inspiration for biscuits or domination for the 2 healing options. I feel it's just really rare that you want both a lane matchup rune, another rune in resolve, and want those things more than taking some other tree secondary.

Resolve primary champs can sometimes opt into it, but it feels like they're often a tank who doesn't die that easy early on and would rather just take conditioning. The main exception I've noticed is tank supports vs bot lanes that can harass with autos.

The one other use I've seen is non marksmen going bot, particularly if their support can heal/shield. But even in those cases I've found it rather meh.
Go back to the old system, this one is just straight trash. You can read about it by other players over a lot of social media. This update is not good...

I disagree with the assertion that this update isn't good. Quite frankly, the previous Runes & Masteries system was incredibly dated and served as a hefty barrier to new players who wanted to get into League of Legends while also tricking players into thinking they had meaningful choice every game. With the new system, it's a lot less overbearing (Runes are free~ There aren't a huge amount of masteries ~ Larger impact for each choice) and, ideally, every champion should have a few different options for keystones rather than feeling pigeonholed into one. From my perspective, this update was necessary to make League of Legends a more modern game. 

The Runes Reforged system clearly does need some work to get to where it needs to be for Season 8 but, honestly, it's a massive improvement over what we had and I firmly believe that players will feel the same way in a short period of time.

So what's your insight into the skins?

Based on First impressions, at least I can say I've got something for my JG Karthus to work! :P (Electrocute, Taste of Blood, Ghost poro, Ravenous Hunter with Presence of Mind and Last Stand) 

Builds aside, where do you guys think Karthus stands in the Preseason? Do you think the removal of DFT can justify the revert on that old nerf to Wall of Pain? Just curious :P

I think Jungle Karthus is actually quite strong, primarily due to Ravenous Hunter combined with the large amount of AP you can get level 1 with Sorcery/Inspiration (you couldn't get the same combo of vamp and AP previously because they were both most efficient as Quints).

I don't think he has a high synergy Keystone Jungle though, so I recommend trying Unsealed Spellbook (splash Domination) on him. The 25% reduced summoner cooldown helps his early clear via smite CD, and having Flash on a low CD is very valuable for his ganks. You also get slightly more stats for being Inspiration primary (especially compared to Domination), so combined with the Smite CD I think this is easily his best build for Jungle Clear.

We're actively monitoring problematic champions (Too low, too high) but we saw some Jungle Karthus in our playtests and it seemed decent. If Karthus ends up being in the dumpster, we will take a look. 
Karthus jungle it up my dood

What are your thoughts on the current jungle changes? Do you think they are good long time or do you believe there is likely going to be extra work needed? Also what is the best personal jungle set-ups you guys have thought-up thus far? I keep hearing that it's pretty difficult for some champs in the jungle to stay healthy.

I think the Jungle changes are a step in the right direction, but we usually change something about the Jungle every season so I'm sure over time something will stand out for us to improve upon. 
We've generally found the jungle to be easier to clear, particularly on some of the Junglers who struggled to stay healthy previously like Rengar.

In terms of Jungle setups, we've found success with several different keystones, here are some of the more generalist options:

Dark Harvest: Scaling option as well as the most upfront burst. Has high synergy with those looking for instant damage (lethality Nocturne), as well as bruisers who can navigate teamfights and proc it multiple times (Darkin Kayn).

Electrocute: Generalist option like Thunderlords, a little harder to proc for some but generally just a buffed version.

Predator: Option to improve your gank access. Really nice for some Junglers who lack a gap closer and normally struggle to get on top of targets like Skarner and Volibear.

Aftershock: Option for tanks that provides some damage for ganks as well as tankiness for skirmishes and teamfights.

Unsealed Spellbook: We've found this to be pretty strong by virtue for the Summoner CDR. 25% reduced smite CD can help a lot with early clear, and some Junglers have extremely high synergy with Flash like Gragas or Fiddlesticks.  You also get slightly more stats for primarying Inspiration than other trees, and are allowed to pick what stat you want via choosing your splash, so this overall gives you the best clear power.

Several other Keystones have their niche users as well. I'm really interested to see what people end up settling on.

Hard to say this early (although I personally enjoy the changes) since SO much is different with Runes.  I would however expect some sort of follow up, as that will almost certainly be necessary eventually.  

For summoner setups I personally like champions that can utilize dark harvest (blue kayne for example).  Others on the team have found success with things like unsealed spellbook simply for the reduced CD of smite/flash (Trade flash with an enemy on first gank -> come back once your flash comes back up b/c theirs will still be down for a bit).

If you find yourself struggling to survive in the jungle, try splashing resolve and taking iron skin.

Hi guys!

I could use some suggestions! I recently played a game as Camille against an Akali (I realize this is not a great matchup, but I was first pick) with soul harvester and early on she was two hitting me for half of my health!

Do you guys think early soul harvester is granting too much damage and how can I counter it regardless?

I do expect Akali to be one of the best lane users of Dark Harvest due to her strong windowed trading with Q in melee matchups and ability to all-in with the proc post 6 via her Ultimate. 
In general the counterplay to Dark Harvest in lane is to avoid trading with them while they have the proc. They only get it off cannon minions and champions, so generally they will only have the proc every 3 waves. During those 1/3 waves they have a significant advantage, but during the other 2/3 of the lane you have a Keystone up on them.

Hey, 

Diamond 3 ekko main here, what are your thoughts on him? Any chance he gets some attack speed/ap to compensate for losing out on rune stats?

Hey there,

I am the resident Ekko main in the team. I think Ekko is pretty bad right now because he doesn't love Electrocute and he got particularily hurt by not being able to spec certain stats (enough AP to 1 shot the wave with 2 qs, AS reds, etc). Also expect jungle Ekko to struggle because he does not have access to AS for the early clear.

Do you think there is a possibility that the stats from choosing your tree (attack speed with Precision, for example) could become more flexible? I feel that there are quite a few champions who would really like to spec into certain keystones, but have a hard time justifying doing so because they get a suboptimal stat from their tree choice. 

Take Jhin for example. From what I've tried with him, Fleet Footwork is a pretty good keystone, but since he doesn't get a lot of use out of  attack speed it feels like that bonus is somewhat wasted. He'd much rather get flat AD from Sorcery or Domination, but none of the keystones really stand out for him there.

I suppose there will always be some losers with the new system and some champs who don't have as many options as others. In general  though I think giving players more choice about what stat bonuses they want (and keeping that separate from what runes they want) would be a step towards creating better diversity.
